text_clean: The Russian invasion of Ukraine has made it clear we should not tolerate authoritarian regimes. Now is the time for liberal democracies to stand united against China’s growing threat to democracy and freedom. HTTPURL

Simply acknowledging #HumanRightsDay today isn’t enough. China is undermining freedoms for #HongKongers + others. Saudi Arabia killed a US journalist w/impunity. Our Border Patrol has let children die in custody. Rights are under threat around the globe. We cannot be silent. HTTPURL

China's Great Firewall of censorship and digital authoritarianism is spreading among its neighbors. The U.S. must lead the way on digital trade and a free and open internet, or else China will continue to export policies that endanger human rights and democratic values. HTTPURL

Freedom of expression and freedom from tyranny in Hong Kong must be preserved. The people of Hong Kong deserve these unalienable rights. I call on @USER to make it absolutely clear that the United States will not tolerate violations of human rights. HTTPURL

We have deep respect for the brave efforts of Hong Kong people from every walk of life who have demonstrated their clear desire for freedom, democracy, and the rule of law. The House Foreign Affairs Committee has called upon Beijing to cease encroaching on Hong Kong’s autonomy. HTTPURL

Those complicit in snuffing out freedom, democracy, and human rights in Hong Kong must be held accountable. @USER should immediately call a vote on the Hong Kong Accountability Act, which unanimously passed the Senate last week. HTTPURL

As a nation that values freedom, the US must remain a leader in defending human rights. Congress must pass the Uyghur Human Rights Protection Act now to expedite the visa process for Uyghur refugees. We must be true to our values as Americans. HTTPURL I commend @USER' announcement of a diplomatic boycott of the 2022 Beijing Olympics. HTTPURL

RT @USER Have yet to hear/read a compelling case for why "China potentially reversed a 2016 Saudi decision to diplomatically freeze out Iran over protests" somehow signals a post-U.S. Middle East. Also: Possible China involving itself deeper in MidEast is bad for it and good for U.S.?

China continues to undermine Hong Kong’s autonomy. I joined a @USER resolution condemning the violation of the rights of the #HongKong people and calling on @USER to work with our allies to protect human rights and ensure accountability.
HTTPURL

31 years ago, students, workers, citizens stood up for freedom in Tiananmen Square against the repressive Chinese Communist Party As peaceful protestors across America stand up to end injustice, these students' example should remind us of how America can stand up for our ideals
Time for democratic nations to call out #China's unacceptable violation of human rights in #HongKong that the 1997 “one country two systems” treaty was created to protect. HTTPURL

Now that Congress has passed the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, Pres Trump should sign it into law. The American people stand w/ the people of Hong Kong, who should be free to peacefully express their democratic rights without being violently repressed.

RT @USER Chairs welcome this action to sanction firms that aid in the repressive surveillance of Uyghurs, Tibetans and others. With passage of the Uyghur Forced Labor Prevention Act, the US government is expanding the use of tools to go after those who commit and abet crimes against humanity. HTTPURL

Three years of President Trump’s failed foreign policy has left the Chinese Communist Party unchecked. President Trump’s weakness enables China to snuff out the people of Hong Kong’s freedoms and for the Chinese Communist Party to spread its influence. HTTPURL
[3/3] We cannot be silent. I continue to #StandwithHongKong and call on local authorities and #China to release pro-democracy leaders and drop their efforts to curtail civil and religious freedoms.

Birds of a feather flock together — Xi and Putin meeting is a clear signal that autocrats worldwide are rooting for freedom and democracy to lose in Ukraine. That’s why you can’t say you’re tough on China if you’re weak on Russia and willing to abandon the people of Ukraine. HTTPURL

A threat to democracy anywhere in the world, is a threat to democracy here at home. It's not just Russia — it's China and others who are hell-bent on stifling the will of the people. We must stand firm. HTTPURL

I continue to stand with the #HongKongProtestors who are fighting against authoritarian rule by Beijing. Carrie Lam must withdraw the extradition bill and put an end to the police violence. Trump continues to relinquish America’s moral standing by ignoring Xi’s human rights abuses.

Faced again with an opportunity to target Russia with significant sanctions, Trump again "choked." China is hit with $50 billion in penalties for theft of intellectual property, but no sanctions for Russia’s attempted theft of our democracy. HTTPURL

Today, I attended @USER and @USER hearing on #TiananmenSquare’s 30th anniversary. We heard from Chinese activists and experts on how China’s repression has evolved and how Congress can support the people of China HTTPURL

When China sells products made with forced labor, like solar panels, it hurts American workers. I worked with @USER and @USER to keep these products out of America. I'll keep fighting to protect workers and uphold human rights. HTTPURL 2:17

The UN has confirmed that China is perpetrating human rights abuses against the Uyghur people. I’m glad we took bipartisan action last year to hold China accountable for these crimes, and I will work with my colleagues to stand up against these abuses.
HTTPURL

#LiuXiaobo devoted his life to fighting for human rights and democracy in China. Although sorrow over his death continues to be felt in China and around the world, we will use this anniversary to recommit to this struggle for our shared vision and values. HTTPURL

Nancy Pelosi has fought for human rights in China for decades. These sycophants couldn’t be found when Donald Trump told the General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party that building concentration camps in Xinjiang was “exactly the right thing to do” HTTPURL

Trump says “I don’t care what anybody says” when intel agencies disclosed Russia is interfering in our election to hurt Biden. Of course he doesn’t. He has solicited foreign help again and again. From Russia, Ukraine and China. He doesn’t care about our democracy. Only himself.
Congratulations to Taiwan’s President Tsai on her re-election. This election demonstrates that Taiwan’s democracy is strong and resilient, even amidst difficult times.

If anyone has been at the forefront of the fight for human rights in China—it's @USER. The Chinese communist party won't dictate the actions of our leaders, and as one of the highest-ranked elected officials in our nation, I trust Speaker Pelosi to do as she sees fit. HTTPURL

The brave #HongKongProtesters are fighting for the lives so of course trump remains cowardly silent to appease the Chinese communist party and makes the protests about himself. What a disgrace. HTTPURL

My @USER colleagues and I are calling on the @USER to block polysilicon products made with forced labor in Xinjiang, China from entering America. We must take bold action to uphold our laws, protect American jobs and defend human rights. HTTPURL

RT @USER On March 6, GE-Savant officially moved production of the LED bulbs it makes for Walmart from Ohio to China. But folks in the Buckeye State (including @USER) are continuing to fight for the jobs lost by the decision. HTTPURL

From China to India and in Europe, foreign governments are heavily investing in the production of semiconductor chips. The Chips and Science Act—which I helped pass the Senate today—will boost our manufacturing here at home, create jobs, and lower costs for families. HTTPURL

My new bipartisan legislation will mend the supply chain and bring American jobs back from China. But Congress can only go so far and our big companies must carry the most weight and come home. HTTPURL

RT @USER It's easy to lose track of all of the dangerous decisions this administration makes. But today’s "deal" w/ ZTE is one of the worst. This Chinese state-run company is a known security threat. @USER is selling out Americans to save Chinese jobs.

“I was shouted at and harassed by [business name] cashier, workers, as well as customers at the store to get out of the store. They said, “You Chinese bring the virus here and you dare ask people to keep social distance guidelines.” (Cupertino, CA)

Washington slept on the job while Beijing moved to write the rules of the road from technology to trade. This bill is a comprehensive, bipartisan response to boost US innovation, competition, and security. But it has to be the start of our work, not the end. HTTPURL

GOP criticism aims to harm Biden. Nobody talked about 3:China: #SpyBalloons under Trump—who did nothing 3x. HTTPURL

It is the responsibility of the President of the United States to protect and defend the American people. President Trump should never have counted on the Chinese government to do that. Mr. President – do your job! HTTPURL
With the help of my legislation in the #AmericaCOMPETESAct, we're finally ending our dangerous dependence on manufacturing from China and putting our workers first. HTTPURL

Was interviewed today by @USER on @USER. Discussed Commerce Secretary Ross lying to me about the census citizenship question, the President’s recent veto, my efforts to honor the Chinese railroad workers who helped build the Transcontinental Railroad and other issues. HTTPURL

The damage from Trump’s trade war w/ Mexico will go far beyond Corona and Avocados. Our auto workers will be punished and consumers will see vehicle costs go up >$3,000. American workers and consumers can't afford Trump's two-front trade war with Mexico and China. HTTPURL

This President’s reckless, isolationist trade policy hurts consumers, workers, and our economy. When the President, without a clear strategy, furthers our trade war with China it leads to an array of negative economic consequences.

NEW: The Senate just passed essential legislation to create jobs, strengthen domestic manufacturing and boost U.S. competitiveness. There’s never been a more important time to show authoritarian regimes like China that U.S. leadership on the global stage is here to stay.

This administration’s reckless trade war is having a negative impact on job creation in America. We need a smart, sensible trade policy that holds China accountable and doesn’t hurt American workers, consumers, and families. HTTPURL

With Vice Premier Liu He, I had an extensive discussion about how China's trade-distorting measures end up hurting American workers. I've long been skeptical of trade policy – both at home and abroad – that caters to big corporations instead of working families.

RT @USER And how can Jared Kushner effectively do his job now? How can he manage his policy portfolio, which includes the Middle East and China, with limited access to US intelligence? I've previously said that he should be terminated, and that seems much clearer today.

China is unfairly dumping cheap steel and aluminum onto global markets, but Trump Admin's decision to impose new tariffs on allies continues pattern of focusing on wrong target for wrong reasons. These actions hurt American businesses, workers, and consumers. HTTPURL

China and others are building markets on the African continent and the U.S. is being left behind. This bill will help us build economic ties with African nations and our neighbors in Latin America and the Caribbean to meet the strong demand for American products and create jobs at home. HTTPURL

This is the fifth time in a row that the Trump administration has refused to label China a currency manipulator. I hope this does not portend the administration backing off on Huawei or trade. It would be a tragedy for American workers if they did. HTTPURL

The Trump #ChinaFirst policy strikes again. Cuts a deal with ZTE to save Chinese jobs and gets nothing for our economy or New Jersey. He’s tougher on Canada than he is on Chinese currency manipulation and billions of dollars of intellectual property theft. Makes you wonder why… HTTPURL

American workers are the foundation of the world's largest and most innovative economy. When given a level playing field, they outcompete the world. Yet non-market economies like China manipulate and rig the rules, breaking trade laws and undermining our workers in the process.
Too many American auto #jobs have already been lost overseas. @USER’s plan will ship more to China. HTTPURL

Proud to support your amendment in the Banking Committee, @USER. China’s ZTE violated U.S. sanctions against Iran and North Korea. This Administration is trading our national security for an empty trade deal that will only benefit Chinese workers. HTTPURL

Taiwan is a free and open society and a long-term partner for the United States. I am committed strengthening our relationship, advancing mutual trade goals, and promoting innovation and economic growth for our workers and businesses. HTTPURL
China’s resumption of auto tariffs puts thousands of SC auto jobs at risk. The president must end his trade war and work with our allies to address concerns with China responsibly. HTTPURL

The @USER are quietly planning to close a Minnesota factory they own, lay off American workers and outsource the jobs to China. They were hoping to keep this quiet so we wouldn't object. Let's prove them wrong. Tell the MLB to #StopOutsourcing.

Now confirmed: MLB-owned baseball gear producer is closing Minnesota facility, moving manufacturing jobs to China. I’m not going to let them quietly move forward with this. They need to keep those jobs in Minnesota.

Today I met w/ the ND Soybean Growers Association and discussed the impact of the administration’s trade war on ND farmers. Soybeans are a bright spot for ND farmers, but the value their crop this year and beyond is at risk because of the trade war w/ China—their largest customer. HTTPURL
